name: The Sidney Pier Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Was in Sidney for a conference and booked a single Essential King Room. I had a couple of options at the front desk - the Trip Advisor "free room upgrade" and a preferential rate that the conference had apparently arranged with the Pier. The woman at the front desk couldn't find any information about a preferential rate and the "upgrade" wasn't possible because there weren't any rooms at the next level available. However, she was quite accommodating and was able to give me the BC resident rate which took about $10 off the room rate. Doesn't hurt to ask.
reviews.title: Essentially Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and well laid out - comfortable bed and tastefully decorated. The Essential is just that - bed, desk, flatscreen TV (with built in DVD player), and a chair. Washroom was shower only, no tub. Not an issue for me. This room was on the street side so no ocean view ... not sure if this was the designated "haggle room" or if all of the Essential rooms are street side.
reviews.title: I want to move in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Building was quiet once I figured out how to turn the heat/ac fan off - it would have been impossible to sleep with it on. No need for a wake up call as flights from nearby Sidney airport around 6:00 were loud enough to wake you up.
reviews.title: Great new hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: All in all a good looking room for a fairly reasonable price. And it is worth checking the charge when you check out - they "overcharged" me by about $70 but were very open about it being incorrect and charged me the right amount when I left. I imagine this is probably a hotel policy to get a "deposit."
reviews.title: I Could Live Here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We live in this area, and for a birthday treat, my husband took me here for the night and a nice dinner in Sidney. We did not want to leave the room to go out for dinner! We realized we should have just picked up some food from one of the excellent local restaurants and stayed in.
reviews.title: Peace and Quiet, and our dog came too!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in the spring of 2011. We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite and didn't want to leave. The view is fantastic looking over the pier and sound and watching boats come and go out of the downtown marina. The hotel is downtown and within walking distance of restaurants, shops and the marina. The kitchen is small with high end appliances. We cooked dinner both nights in the suite because it was so relaxing just sitting on the balcony, watching the view. It was so nice to cook there, it was equipped with everything we needed and all the kitchen equipment were quality products. That was such a nice change from most hotels with kitchens we have stayed in. We bought fresh fish and shrimp from the fish market on the pier and walked to the market across the street from the hotel for the rest of the ingredients. The master bathroom was enormous, with dual sinks, large tub and separate shower. There also was a second bathroom with shower and one sink just inside the front door. The weather was our typically Pacific Northwest gray days and we enjoyed sitting in front of the fireplace each evening. Downstairs just off the lobby is a shop with baked goodies, breakfast and lunch items and coffees and teas. We bought a loaf of artisan bread to go with our dinner the second day and breakfast items each morning and they were wonderful. The hotel was exceptionally clean, even all the corners! My husband kept saying he would be very happy living in a place just like that! We never used the dining room table because the deck was so nice but the table was beautiful.
reviews.title: I could move in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a peaceful 2 nights in a studio suite with a partial oceanview. Quiet, comfortable, clean, and a well designed modern motif. The king bed was marvelous and the blackout curtains helped us to really sleep in late and relax.
reviews.title: Why spend more to stay in Victoria? This hotel beats all and a good price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great bakery and Starbucks were within a quick walk of the hotel so a quick breakfast was easy to put together. The kitchenette enabled us to pack lunches for our hiking adventures and the single door dishwasher made that chore a cinch.
reviews.title: " Excellent Hotel and Staff "

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Really appreciated their concern for the environment with the in-room recycling basket,Toto toilet with dual flush option and low-flow rain shower head. The only negative is that those with thick hair will spend extra time trying to rinse out shampoo.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended in Sidney, B.C.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You are going to have to work to find a negative about this hotel and mine would be the free but SLOW wifi. Connect instead to the Sidney City free wifi connection instead. Staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Perfect romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We needed a place to stay close to the airport to catch an early flight. We locked into this special hotel and we didn't know what we were getting. What a wonderful place with wonderful people and incredible views over the water. The British gentleman at the counter was extremely nice and very helpful. He shuttled us to the airport at 5:00am and didn't complain not once. I just wish we could have stayed longer. Next time for sure!
reviews.title: What a Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 6 nights in a Junior-Suite. First the essentials:
reviews.title: Great in many ways, but a few service/room minor issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - the king size bed was very very comfortable
reviews.title: Second time here, we'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - the room had very good curtains and blinds, re blocking the morning and afternoon sun
reviews.title: Modern and Comfortable with a Stunning Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: - the kitchenette was easy to use (except for the toaster, which wasn't working because the electrical outlet wasn't working).
reviews.title: Would stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in November and were thoroughly impressed for the whole stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful Place, Great Amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The King Suite with the Full Kitchen is a great value, especially if you like to save by cooking your own meals, and spend the remaining money on a better class of accommodations, which has been our plan of late.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only 2 comments are that the heating and cooling system seems to whistle a bit, and the drapes in our suite didn't actually cover the small sliver of glass where one of the small jogs in the outside wall create a 6 inch return.
reviews.title: Fabulous Out of the Way Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd highly recommend this as a great getaway spot!
reviews.title: A Five Star Experience!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is fabulous. We stayed in one of the Signature Pier Suites and it had everything we needed with a fully equipped kitchen. AND THE VIEWS~Just gorgeous!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

description: 55-room boutique hotel, spa, oceanfront restaurant & lounge, and cafe, opened in May 2007. Located on the waterfront in the charming seaside town of Sidney, British Columbia on Vancouver Island - just 10 minutes from the Victoria International Airport, BC Ferries to Vancouver, and Washington State Ferries to Anacortes, Washington. 30 minute drive to downtown Victoria. Complimentary use of 24 hour Fitness Centre. 3 Meeting/Function rooms for groups up to 60 people.
